title: List of poppy seed pastries and dishes
data: Pancake made with a rice flour batter , garnished with grated coconut , peanuts , sesame seeds , and poppy seeds
A traditional Ukrainian , Russian , Belarusian and Lithuanian ( riestainis ) bread roll . By far the most popular variety of bublik has a liberal amount of poppy seeds added to it

A fluffy yeast dough dumpling with a mix of poppy seeds and sugar , filled with spicy plum jam and melted butter on top , often eaten with vanilla cream sauce . It is a culinary speciality of Austria , Bavaria , and Bohemia . The dish is served both as a dessert and as a main course

A triangular cookie filled with fruit preserves or honey and black poppy seed paste , eaten during the Jewish holiday of Purim . Hamantashen are made with many different fillings , including poppy seed ( the oldest and most traditional variety ) , prunes , nut , date , apricot , apple , fruit preserves , cherry , chocolate , dulce de leche , halva , or even caramel or cheese . Their formation varies from hard pastry to soft doughy casings
A traditional East Slavic bread , commonly served during various ritual meals . The name originates from the Old Slavonic word kolo ( коло ) meaning circle , wheel
Polish noodles with poppy seeds . Polish Christmas dishes may include poppy seeds because they are thought to help with sleeping peacefully

A traditional pastry in Polish cuisine , originally a wedding cake that has made its way into American homes around the Christmas and Easter holidays . The pastry is a light and flaky dough filled with a variety of sweet and savory fillings such as apricot , raspberry , prune , sweet cheese , poppy seed or even a nut mixture
Колач со афион ( cake with poppy )
A sweet grain and poppy seed pudding from Ukraine
These are popular in the US
Hungarian poppyseed roll , also known as Christmas bread
Mákos guba ( Poppy seed bread pudding )
A Hungarian bread pudding dessert made from crescent rolls , poppy seeds , and milk
A dessert in Hungarian cuisine made with noodles , poppy seeds and sugar
A nut roll filled with poppy seed paste
A Croatian poppy seed cake or roll

A traditional poppy seed-based dessert from Central Europe . It is most notable in Silesia , where it is served almost exclusively on Christmas Eve ( and perhaps on the following days , as long as the supply prepared for Christmas lasts )
A sweet filled pastry with poppy seeds
Poppyseed strudel popular in Germany and Austria
intro: This is a list of poppy seed pastries and dishes. Poppy seed is an oilseed obtained from the opium poppy (Papaver somniferum). The tiny kidney-shaped seeds have been harvested from dried seed pods by various civilizations for thousands of years. The seeds are used, whole or ground, as an ingredient in many foods, and they are pressed to yield poppyseed oil. Poppy seeds are less than a millimeter in length, and minute: it takes 3,300 poppy seeds to make up a gram, and a pound contains between 1 and 2 million seeds. The primary flavor compound is 2-Pentylfuran.
